  • Element
org.dejava.component.util.validation.annotation

Annotation Type ValidationMethod


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=ANNOTATION_TYPE)
public @interface ValidationMethod
    Defines a new validation method for a field. The validation must be performed by invoking the method with the given name. It will be invoked in a static context if only the validation method class (clazz) is given (but not the JNDI object name). If the JNDI object name is given, the class will be ignored and the method will be invoked from within the JNDI object. The first parameter of the method must always expect the value compatible with the annotated field value. The next parameters values used are from the given complementary fields (complementaryFieldsPaths). The expected types should be compatible with each field type and value. In addition, other parameters can be used. Their classes and values should be defined in a proper place (otherParametersClasses and otherParametersValues). The parameters values are converted from String via the given class constructor (that must take one String as parameter). If more classes than values are given, the missing values will be considered as null. A null value can also be specified by providing the expression in the NULL_EXPRESSION field. If validateItems is true (default is false), the field value will not be validated directly. Instead, every object in the array/Iterable represented by the field value will be validated.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String methodName
      Validation method name.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> clazz
      Class from which to invoke the validation method.
      java.lang.String[] complementaryFieldsPaths
      Complementary fields paths (field1.field2...).
      boolean ignoreOnNull
      If the validation should be ignored when the field value is null.
      java.lang.String jndiObjectName
      JNDI object name to lookup.
      java.lang.Class<?>[] otherParametersClasses
      Other parameters classes for the method.
      java.lang.String[] otherParametersValues
      Other parameters values for the method.
      boolean validateItems
      If true (default is false), the field value will not be validated directly.

    • Element Detail

      • methodName

        public abstract java.lang.String methodName
        Validation method name. A method with the given name will be invoked to perform the validation.

      • clazz

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> clazz
        Class from which to invoke the validation method. Will be ignored if an JNDI object is given. By default, the BasicValidations class is used.
        Default:
        org.dejava.component.util.validation.BasicValidations.class

      • jndiObjectName

        public abstract java.lang.String jndiObjectName
        JNDI object name to lookup. If given, the validation will be made by invoking the method from this object.
        Default:
        ""

      • validateItems

        public abstract boolean validateItems
        If true (default is false), the field value will not be validated directly. Instead, every object in the array/Iterable represented by the field value will be validated. The validation processor does not support null values in the array/Iterable.
        Default:
        false

      • complementaryFieldsPaths

        public abstract java.lang.String[] complementaryFieldsPaths
        Complementary fields paths (field1.field2...). Every given field will be passed as arguments during the method call (in the given order). The expected types should be compatible with each field type and value.
        Default:
        {}

      • otherParametersClasses

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?>[] otherParametersClasses
        Other parameters classes for the method. In addition to the field value itself and the complementary fields, other parameters can be provided for the validation method. Must be used together with otherParametersValues.
        Default:
        {}

      • otherParametersValues

        public abstract java.lang.String[] otherParametersValues
        Other parameters values for the method. The parameters values are converted from String via the given class constructor (must take one String as parameter). If more classes than values are given, the missing values will be considered as null. A null value can also be specified by providing the expression in the NULL_EXPRESSION field.
        Default:
        {}

      • ignoreOnNull

        public abstract boolean ignoreOnNull
        If the validation should be ignored when the field value is null. Default is true.
        Default:
        true
